runs.comm: slipping leg-side first ball, and clipped behind square to get the innings going
Dilshan comes round the wicket, tossing it up wide of off and Lumb pushes through the covers for a couple as the fielder fumbles
quicker, straighter, and he's pulled the length back a touch too. Tapped to point
Lumb opens the face on this one to guide it just to the right of short third man, who dives to save the boundary but can't stop the single
full and driven down the ground for one
a bit of width given, Lumb cuts but plays over the top of the ball. They opt against a quick single as the under edge trickles behind square on the off side
full and wide of off, Kieswetter drives confidently but straight to cover
great length, Kieswetter pushes forward watchfully to push the ball back to the bowler
not afraid to use his feet is Kieswetter! Comes down the track and flays to off, but again picks the fielder
pitched straighter and turning in to the right-hander, who hangs back to flick to leg, but can't beat the field
too full this time, and Kieswetter bunts down the ground with a straight bat
good, accurate start from Mendis as Lumb drives to mid off with no great certainty
on the money straight away, finding a great line and a touch of turn in to the batsman, who stretches forward to defend
little shimmy down the track from Kieswetter to get to the pitch, he slices the drive a little as he tries to go inside out over cover, but gets enough on it to reach the boundary. England are away!
and again! Kieswetter is coming at Randiv here, again he comes down the track and gets a really good connection on this one to send it in an arc that comes down just inside the boundary at long off
intelligent batting from Kieswetter, after the two big shots comes the nurdle to rotate
absolutely huge shout for lbw as Lumb bends to slog sweep, but that was really hopeful from Sri Lanka. Heading way over
Lumb uses his feet now! He hasn't middled that as he lofts over cover, but they pick up an easy two

he finds the edge first ball! Length, Kieswetter came forward but played inside the ball, regulation edge that would have been easily snaffled by first slip, except there isn't one. And third man is up, so that's four
Kieswetter dances down, even though Sangakkara is up to the stumps, but slaps the ball straight to cover
opens the face on this one, trying to get it past that short third man, but can't beat him. Lumb wisely sends Kieswetter back

big shout for lbw! Seam up delivery from Mathews, Kieswetter came forward and across and was struck just above the boot on the left foot. Replays suggest that was stone dead, but Kieswetter was advancing so there must have been some doubt in the umpires mind. What's more, the ball's rolled down to fine leg for four!
much more watchful this time, pushing gently to cover
six! Kieswetter comes down again to turn the ball into a meaty half-volley and sends it right back over the bowler's head. Great connection there, there was a man out but it sailed over him
and he's greeted with a superb chip shot from Lumb. Delightful, he just picked that up straight back over Malinga. England are on the charge, and it's coming off nicely
Malinga pulls the length back a touch and Lumb forces into the covers, but straight to the fielder
cutter from Malinga this time, aimed at the pads and beats Lumb's swish to leg to strike thigh pad
Malinga sends down another slower ball as Lumb backs away to leg. He must've seen him going, but he just lost control of that one
and again! Who is out-thinking who here? Lumb moves to off this time and Malinga sends it even wider
better from Malinga, tucking the batsman up a touch, but he gets enough on it to scamper through for one

spicy! Kieswetter came down the track and Malinga saw him coming. He fired in a very sharp bouncer that took the batsman by surprise. He just about got out the way in time though as the ball whizzed past his helmet
short again, this one looked like the slower bouncer and Kieswetter kept his eye on it, dropping the hands on the shot as the ball fizzed past
positive from Lumb, who immediately uses his feet to get to the pitch and send the ball to long off for one
Kieswetter backs away to give himself room and thrashes to off, but finds point

comedy of errors! Bad cricket all round, as Kieswetter sliced in the air just short of the fielder. Lumb set off for a run that was never there and was 3/4 of the way down before Kieswetter sent him back. He should've been out by yards, but Mendis fumbled the return throw to let him get back. Sangakkara is speechless behind the stumps...
defence this time from Kieswetter after all the action of the last ball
and now the shot, as Kieswetter comes out to smash Mendis imperiously straight back over his head. That'll relieve the nerves after the silly running
four more! Flicked leg side this time, finer than he was aiming for but in the even the placement was perfect. Runs are flowing for England!
calmly driven by Lumb, straight to the cover fielder
and again, he pulls the length back a touch and Lumb is unable to find the gap on the off side
there's the release shot! Lumb goes to his slog sweep and he's nailed it. Powerfully hit, a couple of bounces and over the ropes at deep midwicket
he's in action straight away as Lumb sweeps again. The damage is limited this time though, as the fielder is there to cut it off
too straight, Kieswetter nudges to leg, straight to the short fine leg fielder actually, but they set off straight away and that's a sharp single to some very average fielding
beaten! Lumb goes to cut but plays underneath it as the tall offspinner finds some extra bounce
fired in from round the wicket, clipped into space at midwicket to rotate the strike

Lumb unfurls his reverse sweep straight away, struck on the pad via the glove and the fielders are up for a huge lbw shout. A look of disdain from the umpire soon quietens them though. There was no way that was out
down the track and chipped down the ground for one

smashed! Kieswetter came down the track to play his signature inside out drive over wide long off and he's got a lot on that. The ball sailed several rows back into the crowd, and these two batsmen are really beginning to look at ease now. Great shot, and Sri Lanka are beginning to slump in the field
good batting, he taps it away to take the one and rotate the strike
Lumb joins in now! Down the track, of course, and he drives majestically over the covers and all the way for six. 15 runs for the over!

and he's their man, as Kieswetter falls! Searing, inswinging yorker from Malinga splays the stumps. Kieswetter had picked the fuller length and shaped to drive to long on, but that was simply too good for him, and Malinga has made a mess of his stumps.
slower cutter landing on a length on off stump first ball, and KP leans out to drop it on the off side
another slower ball from Malinga, and KP was slightly early on the shot there, driving uppishly down to long on. No fielder at mid on though, and they take a single
ooh, was there a little tickle on that one? Malinga pushed a cutter across Lumb, who drove loosely at it. Not that it matters much, as the ball dropped well short of Sangakkara

dropped! That was a tough chance, but you've got to take those at this level. Lumb chipped down the ground but got right underneath that one. Kulasekara ran in and got to it, but couldn't hold onto the ball as he tumbled forward.

well, more shoddy work in the field there from Sri Lanka, and it must be said, another piece of brainless running from Lumb, who sprinted out as soon as he had clipped a short ball to mid off. KP wanted no part of it, and again Lumb should've been run out. Sloppy fielding has let him off
driven just between the cover and mid off fielders, but not timed particularly well and so a single is the result

Sri Lanka are unravelling a little in the field. Lumb slashed at a length ball angled across him, cutting it behind point. The fielder ran round from third man to cut it off, got a hand to it, but the ball trickled over the boundary all the same
four more, Lumb dances down the track to change the length and nails the inside-out lofted drive over cover. One bounce, and over the ropes. England are cruising, despite the wicket

well, he's just got a little too cute and inventive there. He'd already taken nine from the over, but Lumb shuffles right across to off, exposing all three stumps, and Perera zoned in on leg stump to rattle his timber. They need fives an over, but Lumb got a little greedy there and has paid the price
Colly is off the mark straight away, pushing the ball down the ground for one
handsomely driven by Pietersen, who got down on one knee to hammer that through the covers. A committed dive from the cover sweeper cuts it off though, and they settle for two
pushed quietly down the ground by Collingwood, and that's all he really needs to do with Pietersen at the other end
round the wicket from Randiv, and that one went on with the arm to take the leading edge into the covers. Between the fielders though, and they scamper a single
good, tight line from round the wicket, and Collingwood is content to defend for the time being
out comes the nurdle, as Collingwood finds space to the left of the short fine leg fielder

clean hitting from Pietersen! Slammed way, way over long on from a full, healthy swing of the bat. That went over the grass bank and almost out of the ground. Humungous - 100-metre six, the fourth biggest of the tournament
and he follows that up with a little nudge to leg to take one and keep the strike
Pietersen dances down the track and punches down the ground
ditto Collingwood, as England pick up another easy single to long on
flatter from Mendis, but too short and Pietersen picked up the length early to slap it through the covers
nudged down the ground, and England creep ever closer to a place in the World Twenty20 finals
width given, and Pietersen gets down to cut, cross-batted, out to the cover sweeper
well, good ball to finish but England are coasting. Tight on off stump, and Colly comes forward to defend
short from Malinga, but Pietersen kept his eye on it the whole way, rocking back to complete a muscly pull out to deep midwicket. Good running fetches two runs
slower cutter this time, Pietersen looked to be too early into the bottom-handed chip down the ground, but there's no fielder anywhere close, and they get another easy single down the ground.
back of a length again from Malinga, Collingwood sways back to guide it down to fine leg
bouncer from Malinga, but that never really got up and Pietersen stood up tall to pull strongly behind square and the ball races away for four more
short again, and once again Pietersen muscles a pull. The ball ends up infront of square this time, and there's a fielder there to cut it off
Malinga goes fuller, but strays onto Collingwood's legs and is tucked neatly out wide of deep midwicket, two more to the England scorecard
Pietersen hangs back in his crease and drops the ball out to point for a sprinted single. One more!
length, chopped out on the off side for another single. No pressure at all, singles on off all round the ground
full and ripping away just a touch. Collingwood comes forward to defend
full and driven, the fielder at extra covers makes an attempt to cut it off but can't get a hand to it. Long off cleans up, and they run another
Pietersen looks for the single to the cover sweeper, but finds point

Collingwood falls, but that's probably come too late for Sri Lanka. He was looking for the big shot on the leg side, but the bottom hand came through just a little too strongly as he swished across the line. A top edge sent the ball straight up in the air, and Sangakkara behind the stumps called for it
Pietersen, utterly unfazed, takes full toll of a short, wide long hop, cutting hard behind point and finding perfect placement to beat the field
Perera tightens up with an off stump line, which Pietersen defends down a little awkwardly
Pietersen walks down and slaps the ball down to long on for one
too short, too wide, and Morgan nudges calmly out on the off side to get off the mark. No fielders in, no effort to create pressure
Perera aims for the yorker, but Pietersen stays deep in the crease to work the ball out to midwicket to keep the strike. Single figures needed now
he's not given up yet, steaming in to fire in a pinpoint yorker. Pietersen jams his bat down in time though
Pietersen uses his feet, coming out to whip the ball to midwicket, but he hits it straight to the fielder. No run
knee-high full toss from Malinga, and Pietersen clips out to square leg. They amble through for a walked single
another good yorker from Malinga, but Morgan opens the face a touch as he digs it out, and they pick up a single square of the wicket on the off side

what a shot, flicked with ease by Pietersen in the air over wide long on. He hardly seemed to hit it, but the ball just kept on going. Everything was right about that shot, the position of the feet, the weight distribution, and he just hit cleanly through the ball.
and there's the game, Pietersen drives down to long on, beating the mid on fielder with ease, and England are in the finals of the World Twenty20!
